hero.title: The Cancer Moonshot<sup>SM</sup> Biobank

0.body: People with cancer donate blood and tissue samples during their treatment, for up to 5 years.

1.body: The Biobank receives the samples and sends them to researchers.

2.body: Researchers develop ideas to test on many different samples and advance their understanding of cancer.

3.body: Researchers work to find discoveries that improve cancer treatments and increase survival.

mission.body: The Cancer Moonshot<sup>SM</sup> Biobank is a 5-year project to learn more about cancer with the help of participants who donate samples as they receive treatment.
mission.link: What to expect if you participate
mission.title: Our Mission

closed_account.body: Please contact your clinical research coordinator if you have any questions.
closed_account.title: Your account is closed.

participate.body: By joining the Biobank, you can be a part of the discovery of new cancer therapies, helping patients everywhere.

0.body: Participants get a biomarker test, which can help your doctor find new treatments or clinical trials specific to your individual cancer. There is no charge for the test.
0.title: Biomarker tests tell you more about your cancer.

1.body: Cancer treatments don't work the same way for everyone—samples from many different communities will help us understand why this is and how to improve cancer care.
1.title: Diverse participation improves cancer care.

2.body: By collecting samples over time, researchers can observe how cancer changes and how to stop it from growing and spreading.
2.title: Together we can advance our understanding of cancer.
